result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Earl Richard Armistead

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Earl Richard Armistead not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Earl Richard Armistead.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for plea hearing.  Defense requests an adjourned plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Earl Richard Armistead not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea hearing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court rescheduled hearing.  This matter will be held in person in room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Earl Richard Armistead not in court, in custody at CJF.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Francesco Mineo.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Status conference held.  Defense requests a plea date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Earl Richard Armistead not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Earl Richard Armistead in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Earl Richard Armistead in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Scott Lackovic.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court by video, defendant Earl Richard Armistead not in court, in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared  in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Due to Court congestion Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Earl Richard Armistead not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact order signed and filed

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  24 hour curfew with the exception of verified court, medical and legal appointments.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $80,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BMO Harris Bank, Brewery Credit Union, Self-Help Federal Credit Union, Dina A B, Ashanti H, Ebony T J, Jarvis A, and Alicia M

Defendant Earl Richard Armistead in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Earl Richard Armistead in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Earl Richard Armistead appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
